0964240ED2B54578954AFF9EF261F4C3.description: identify the strategies that helped them present and communicate their message, and explain how they helped them improve as a text creator

42F31FB195E9487AAA8DEF39E75A8CFB.description: present the texts they have created using appropriate strategies, including by reading aloud with expression

7912BB54DE17408EBB3E2C15CBF38D8B.description: produce final texts using simple techniques, to achieve the intended effect

8C9DD08FDC8A4EEFAF82D292FB35D97C.description: Publishing, Presenting, and Reflecting: select suitable and effective media, techniques, and tools to publish and present final texts, and critically analyze how well the texts address various topics

91FB0C08915E4E1EA68373D28C5C3CC5.description: edit draft texts to improve accuracy and style, checking for errors in spelling, punctuation, grammar, and text conventions, and proofread edited texts to make corrections

4A86F30904584F85BB02139E13096A63.description: make simple revisions to draft texts, including replacing words and adding sentences, to improve content and clarity, using feedback from others

4CB1118185CD4D9AA6C264F054A4D761.description: identify the point of view, including first person or third person, used in their texts

662B31691AC2496AA55AA81DB812355B.description: demonstrate a personal voice in their texts, using descriptive words and sentence patterns to express their thoughts, feelings, and opinions about the topic

B3A4B86C6F07448CA43C20F31DC51FFA.description: begin to write in cursive, forming letters with appropriate formation patterns, size, placement, and spacing

4A6EC5AFAFE2455587042A063979F02A.description: draft short texts of various forms and genres, including narrative, persuasive, and informational texts, using a variety of media, tools, and strategies

FBDCF16EA2BE40ACBD92BB8BF1C5F6F3.description: Creating Texts: apply knowledge and understanding of various text forms and genres to create, revise, edit, and proofread their own texts, using a variety of media, tools, and strategies, and reflect critically on created texts

7EB9AC1B39D945248F2C21CDF4FF33C4.description: identify the strategies that helped them develop ideas for texts and organize content

20EB90B38CD34548AF94AC9C9196B42B.description: sort and sequence ideas and information, using appropriate strategies and tools, taking into account the text form and genre to be used

D2F92DFE9BC04FB9863817324DB7EB9D.description: gather information and content relevant to a topic, using three or more sources

3E40AEAB12FE457291A55664CA8D6283.description: generate and develop ideas about given and chosen topics, using various strategies, and drawing on various resources, including their own lived experiences, and learning from other subject areas

88699BE73F9A4753B218AC3B019A7812.description: identify the topic, purpose, and audience for various texts they plan to create, and describe how the chosen text form and genre will help communicate their intended meaning

3933034041784BE0899BE1E637FB4CCB.description: Developing Ideas and Organizing Content: plan, develop ideas, gather information, and organize content for creating texts of various forms, including digital and media texts, on a variety of topics

85F68D0F008043729D6D747F41FE0132.description: Composition: Expressing Ideas and Creating Texts

DB50D996A7D742CD82B0218C4657C53B.description: identify thinking skills that have helped them analyze and better understand various texts

523E6650ED8E4805B8A999CAA3D63944.description: identify some ways in which texts created by First Nations, Métis, and Inuit individuals, communities, groups, or nations communicate about historical periods, cultural experiences, and events, and how they relate to current lived experiences

CEE5D1CD3C204B7EA62861A021050989.description: describe personal thoughts and feelings about ideas presented in texts, such as ideas about diversity, inclusion, and accessibility

BA33DE7AC6664FCEAFC6C8B9BC5D8F33.description: identify explicit and implicit perspectives communicated in texts, providing evidence, and explain how these perspectives could influence an audience

19B9656227DC4CCEAE85AD380E9D7DFA.description: identify some cultural elements represented in various texts, including symbols, language, and values, and pose questions and share ideas about how these elements contribute to the meaning

55EB010A2E69490481B2BB43153906B2.description: analyze various texts, including literary and informational texts, by identifying main and supporting ideas, sequencing information, and comparing and contrasting elements

6AAE2173586E414EA0592FECBF00FBD4.description: make inferences using stated and implied information and ideas to understand texts

84B48475DBBF40B19B97E4898A3083E2.description: identify literary devices, including metaphor and assonance, and describe how they help communicate meaning

18BBD9EEE15248AABDC05E170EB170D4.description: Critical Thinking in Literacy: apply critical thinking skills to deepen understanding of texts, and analyze how various perspectives and topics are communicated and addressed in a variety of texts, including digital, media, and cultural texts

1563E78C7A26446783640F11AA56CA88.description: describe how strategies, such as visualizing, making predictions, and connecting to their experiences, have helped them comprehend various texts

7718C1C3B6C84346B5D75C580E1EF6B1.description: identify the main idea in a simple text, and relate important details in sequence

59BAD4BD009B4FDDB5B04A56305F7190.description: identify connections between ideas expressed in texts and their knowledges and lived experiences, the ideas in other texts, and the world around them

0094CFD624C04335ADF8A101E76C9764.description: use strategies such as rereading, visualizing, and asking questions, to monitor and confirm their understanding of various texts

2FCE3F99560A44A2B780F1FDCA1A29F4.description: make predictions using background knowledge, text features, and evidence from the text, and adjust their understanding based on new information

18F2A53FEE7C4FCCB977DC17A4AD17E0.description: identify specific purposes for engaging with texts, including learning facts or information, or to gain insight or new perspectives

3C091EB9EA24463392F83A7179B1E31D.description: activate prior knowledge, including knowledge gained from personal and text experiences, that they can use to make connections and understand the topic and form of new texts

C122B384A9DC488FBB7ED61FC85BD18C.description: Comprehension Strategies: apply comprehension strategies before, during, and after reading, listening to, and viewing a variety of texts, including digital and media texts, by creators with diverse identities, perspectives, and experience, in order to understand and clarify the meaning of texts

FA422A47848642548100FBF3556B6642.description: read, listen to, and view various forms of texts by diverse First Nations, Métis, and Inuit creators and demonstrate understanding of various aspects of First Nations, Métis, and Inuit histories, cultures, relationships, communities, groups, nations, and lived experiences

32C866A8C26D42349FCBEE785EEC6C0A.description: identify the narrator’s point of view, including first person or third person, in a variety of texts, and suggest alternative points of view to tell each story

C8E956C03CB54D538DE652DF51D18B9E.description: identify some elements of style in texts, including voice, word choice, word patterns, and sentence structure, and explain how they help communicate meaning

A8ECE37C364748E8936707010CB1B0FF.description: describe ways in which images, graphics, and visual design are used in a given text, and demonstrate an understanding of their purpose and connection to the content of the text

E1F2B0CE2F9A4410A496DC8820A6AF14.description: identify some text patterns, such as order of importance and cause and effect, and text features, such as headings and an index, associated with various text forms, and explain how they help readers, listeners, and viewers understand the meaning

B9EF62BCCD384B3BB8EAD61DCFF47D6D.description: identify and describe some characteristics of literary and informational text forms and their associated genres

A43D7059432F4A66B0B8BCD82D00E555.description: read and comprehend various texts, using knowledge of words, grammar, cohesive ties, sentence structures, and background knowledge

2DADDF2D0B524EE1ABA4055B33D233D7.description: Knowledge about Texts: apply foundational knowledge and skills to understand a variety of texts, including digital and media texts, by creators with diverse identities, perspectives, and experience, and demonstrate an understanding of the patterns, features, and elements of style associated with various text forms and genres

2A95C53B309A486CBF7358E6DF5011C8.description: Comprehension: Understanding and Responding to Texts

D6B57A43F77349E39F17C5C2EB25DD63.description: use their understanding of the meaning and function of capitalization and punctuation to communicate meaning clearly, including the use of capital letters in dialogue and for words in titles, commas and quotation marks to mark direct speech and direct quotations from texts within sentences, and apostrophes to indicate contractions

D6E2EAF9AC7644E08176A07F41EA555C.description: demonstrate an understanding of the functions of parts of speech in sentences, including possessive nouns, linking verbs and the progressive tense, interrogative adjectives and adverbs, and prepositions and interjections, and use this knowledge to support comprehension and communicate meaning clearly

D454343B95D94C078F926BF8B98F1CDE.description: identify and construct various sentence types and forms, including simple sentences, compound sentences, and complex sentences containing adverbial clauses

A440F8524B724B4BB28ED52256BCF6D1.description: Language Conventions for Reading and Writing demonstrate an understanding of sentence structure, grammar, cohesive ties, and capitalization and punctuation, and apply this knowledge when reading and writing sentences, paragraphs, and a variety of texts

A47CA022DD32449E8736B0BC52F4DBEA.description: read words, complex sentences, and paragraphs in a variety of texts fluently, with accuracy and appropriate pacing to support comprehension, and read aloud using varied expression and intonation according to the purpose of reading

FB73E995FA01441982D12237D19B3673.description: demonstrate an understanding of a variety of words, acquire and use explicitly taught vocabulary in various contexts, including other subject areas, and use morphological knowledge to analyze and understand new words in context

EE488A0534FC4B5381AE2ADABBFBE8D7.description: use developing knowledge of the meanings of words and morphemes (i.e., bases, prefixes, and suffixes) to read and spell words

4F08B254B60748E7AB4D9DAD321215CC.description: use consolidated orthographic knowledge, including position-based tendencies, to make a spelling choice or accurately pronounce a word when reading

93DD7BE0687C46AB878588BDDB3C8960.description: use consolidated phonics knowledge, including phonemic blending to read words and set for variability to correct approximations, and phonemic segmentation to spell phonetically regular monosyllabic and multisyllabic words, in isolation and various text contexts

E6080E59C080466CB037402323E34D80.description: Language Foundations for Reading and Writing: demonstrate an understanding of foundational language knowledge and skills, and apply this understanding when reading and writing

0909C5EC341C4935AE1BFC5955DD87F5.description: use appropriate word choice, including new vocabulary, grammar, and cohesive sentences when speaking and communicating ideas in various contexts, to support audience comprehension

9FC409F52CFB4D6E8BDAFEB1B0B27E78.description: identify and use oral and non-verbal communication strategies, including expression, gestures, and body language, and demonstrate an understanding of how these strategies can contribute to the meaning being conveyed

D718BF2E174145CDB62981A489BF9777.description: identify the purpose and audience for speaking in formal and informal contexts, and use appropriate speaking strategies, including establishing a rapport with the audience, to communicate clearly and coherently

3A36D325B77A4FCA9C469093BAB36764.description: select and use a variety of listening strategies before, during, and after listening to comprehend information communicated orally and non-verbally, recognize when a message is difficult to understand, and develop an appropriate response

D67932D5984348E6B58F21C9C9633741.description: use effective listening skills, including asking questions to clarify information and ideas, in formal and informal contexts and for various purposes, including in small- and large-group conversations and various classroom activities

7FC9DB6F36BA45D9AA262243F11115F0.description: Oral and Non-Verbal Communication: apply listening, speaking, and non-verbal communication skills and strategies to understand and communicate meaning in formal and informal contexts and for various purposes and audiences

A1002BD5FABE4AEFB796CB1955D2E8DC.description: identify themes explored in First Nations, Métis, and Inuit cultures to demonstrate an understanding of the varied identities, perspectives, relationships, legacies, truths, and ways of knowing, being, and doing

0B9EBFE274784B619DE74FFD1314A4C4.description: demonstrate an understanding of the contributions, lived experiences, and perspectives of a diversity of individuals and communities, including those in Canada, by exploring the concepts of identity, self, and sense of belonging in culturally responsive and relevant texts

28AFEF1ABA524A42BF3E24BD64B973F0.description: apply the knowledge and skills developed in this grade to support learning in various subject areas and identify some ways this learning can be used in everyday life

3FCF1CF5CF0D4E719577A0E1A4CE16C2.description: Applications, Connections, and Contributions: apply language and literacy skills in cross-curricular and integrated learning, and demonstrate an understanding of, and make connections to, diverse voices, experiences, perspectives, histories, and contributions, including those of First Nations, Métis, and Inuit individuals, communities, groups, and nations

36286FF6CAAD4E4CA12352586A619F2E.description: communicate and collaborate with various communities in a safe, respectful, responsible, and inclusive manner when using online platforms and environments, including digital and media tools, and demonstrate cultural awareness with members of the community

DB5FE3222077472DB38E50B7675F1708.description: use digital and media tools to support stages of the design process and to develop creative solutions to authentic, real-world problems

58D826E495D5470C8F8DDAD46C1C61F3.description: demonstrate an understanding of the interrelationships between the form, message, and context of a text, the audience, and the creator

498E46F0B42841AFAC90033BE5C65E2C.description: demonstrate an understanding of the forms, conventions, and techniques of digital and media texts, and apply this understanding when analyzing texts

811A8159BC9A491BA9FFDCE76F63670D.description: gather, evaluate, and use information, considering various perspectives, to construct knowledge and demonstrate learning

ED6EABA181AE4BC0B7AA11F68B9473AF.description: demonstrate an understanding of how to navigate online environments safely, manage their privacy, and interact in a way that supports their well-being and that of others, including seeking appropriate permission

C963539DE3B24741B1CBB3E342096E6B.description: demonstrate an understanding of their rights and responsibilities when interacting online with appropriate permission, and make decisions that contribute positively to the development of their digital identity and those of their communities

F521F3C358F84196AF82C52F76D6ED39.description: Digital Media Literacy: demonstrate and apply the knowledge and skills needed to interact safely and responsibly in online environments, use digital and media tools to construct knowledge, and demonstrate learning as critical consumers and creators of media

21378FF026954CD093AF16B5F67B7FDB.description: demonstrate an understanding of how transferable skills help them to express their voice and be engaged in their learning

DE04BF615A5F406795AA447B41FD8821.description: identify how transferable skills can be used to support communication in various cultural, social, linguistic, and domain-specific contexts, and apply them when reading, listening to, viewing, and creating texts of various forms

CAAB2B17B74048DFA18BDA0F256D9231.description: Transferable Skills: demonstrate an understanding of how the seven transferable skills (critical thinking and problem solving; innovation, creativity, and entrepreneurship; self-directed learning; collaboration; communication; global citizenship and sustainability; and digital literacy) are used in various language and literacy contexts
